metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8826 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
All versions of NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys for Windows or nvidia.ko for Linux) where a user can cause a GPU interrupt storm, leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-304 - 304.134-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libcuda1-304-updates - 304.134-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-304 - 304.134-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-304-updates - 304.134-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-current - 304.134-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-304 - 304.134-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-304-updates - 304.134-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-304 - 304.134-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-304-updates - 304.134-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libcuda1-331 - 340.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libcuda1-331-updates - 340.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libcuda1-340 - 340.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1

nvidia-opencl-icd-331 - 340.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-173: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-304 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '304.134-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-340 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '340.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-375 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '375.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
